Summary: The 3 West Club is described as a "hidden treasure" and "best-kept secret" with a superb location near Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral. It offers clean, comfortable rooms at a reasonable price, but without the amenities of a typical chain hotel.

Hotel 414 is a small, intimate haven near Restaurant Row and Times Square, attracting many Europeans and others seeking a calm retreat; it is a tucked-away gem with a charming leafy patio and sensually pleasing bedrooms. It is located on a quiet street and hard to find.

60 Thompson is described as a stylish and intimate hotel with a calm and quiet feel, located on a relatively quiet street in the heart of Soho. Reviewers enjoyed its rooftop bar, chic design, and proximity to many restaurants and shops.

6 Columbus is a small, intimate boutique hotel with modern, sleek design and a trendy vibe. It is located in midtown Manhattan, across from the Time Warner Center, with easy access to Central Park and subway lines.

70 Park Avenue is described as a small, cozy, and chic boutique hotel with a small lobby, located in a quiet area near Grand Central. It has well-appointed, modern rooms and is considered a hidden gem due to its location.

The Ace Hotel has a funky, hipster vibe with unique, urban, and masculine decor, including reclaimed furniture and accessories. It is located in midtown Manhattan, close to Penn Station and a block from a subway stop.

The Affinia 50 is described as a hidden gem with a boutique-y feel, large rooms, a 2nd-floor club room, and a warm, personalized service. Reviews highlight that staff treat guests in a familiar manner and that the hotel feels more like home than a hotel.

The Affinia Dumont is located in a quiet neighborhood, Murray Hill, but is within walking distance of the Empire State Building and other attractions, with a subway stop close by. A few reviewers mention the hotel provides great value, and can be found on discount travel websites.

The Affinia Gardens, located on the Upper East Side, is described as a hidden jewel and oasis, offering spacious, apartment-like rooms with kitchens, providing a tranquil escape from the city's bustle. The hotel's location on a quiet street, combined with a friendly staff, creates a welcoming, home-like atmosphere.

The Affinia Manhattan provides a home-like feeling with a kitchen and spacious rooms, offering a comfortable and convenient experience near Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. Reviews mention a grand lobby and generally helpful staff and also note that the old building has quirky rooms and a musty smell.

The Affinia Shelburne is described as a gem of a hotel that is modern, chic, classy and brilliantly located for a truely unforgettable experience, modern and spacious. Many reviewers mention it is located in Murray Hill, a residential area of Manhattan, near Grand Central station.

AKA United Nations is located on a residential side street, a short walk from Grand Central Terminus and the UN. It offers spacious, modern apartments with well-equipped kitchens, comfortable bedrooms, and access to a 24-hour gym.

The Algonquin Hotel is a charming, historic boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan with a cozy atmosphere and old-world decor, featuring a resident cat and literary history. The hotel has small but clean and well-maintained rooms, and is conveniently located near Times Square and other attractions.

The Americana Inn is described by reviewers as a "hidden gem" and "bargain surprise" due to its good value and clean accommodations. It is also described as a fairly basic, no-frills hotel that is clean and well-maintained.

Amsterdam Court Hotel is a "little gem" or "find" with European ambiance that's centrally located near Broadway and Times Square, but rooms can be small, dark, and have views of brick walls. The lobby and restaurant may appear fancy, but some rooms have dated decor.

Astor on the Park, located on Central Park West, is a basic, clean, and European-style hotel with small rooms, modern bathrooms, and a friendly multilingual staff; it mainly serves as a base for exploring the city and is frequented by European guests. Its location on the upper west side offers a quieter, more residential feel while still being conveniently close to subway lines.

The Bedford Hotel is described as a "little gem" and a "hidden gem" due to its older, European-style charm, spacious rooms with kitchenettes, and great midtown location, making it a good value for the price. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building, and some rooms even have balconies.

The Beekman Tower, an Art Deco building with spacious suites and kitchens, is situated in a quiet, residential part of Midtown Manhattan, near the UN building, offering great views from the upper floors and a rooftop bar. Reviews mention the hotel feeling like a "big but unfancy New York apartment" with a "genteel feel" and "old school class" away from the tourist crowds.

The Hotel Belleclaire is described as a hidden gem with stylish and comfortable rooms in a residential Upper West Side location near Central Park, museums, shops, and restaurants. It has a European feel and is in a charming historic building with rooms more like urban apartments.

The Bentley is described as a little undiscovered gem with reasonable rates, a smaller hotel with a boutique-like feeling, and great bed and comfy warm welcoming back from the front desk. Some reviewers mention being upgraded to suites with great skyline views, which could contribute to the feeling of discovering a hidden treasure.

The Best Western Bowery Hanbee is described as a "hidden gem" and a "small oasis" in the bustling Chinatown/Little Italy area, offering a surprising level of quality and style compared to typical hotels in the area. It's a new or newly renovated property, often praised for its cleanliness, modern design, and comfortable rooms, which stand in contrast to the vibrant, and sometimes chaotic, surrounding neighborhood.

The Best Western Convention Center Hotel is described by guests as a "hidden gem" and a "great find," tucked away in a quiet part of town with clean, modern rooms. Although the hotel is a 15-20 minute walk from Times Square, it has friendly staff, complimentary breakfast, and rooms equipped with amenities, making it a comfortable and convenient base for exploring NYC.

Best Western Hospitality House is described as a "hidden discovery" and "best kept secret" with spacious apartment-style rooms, making guests feel like they have their own New York City apartment. Though the lobby is small, the hotel is centrally located and offers a unique, home-like experience.

The Best Western Seaport Inn is described as a small, charming hotel in a quieter part of Manhattan, near the South Street Seaport, with cobblestone streets and a lack of city traffic. Some reviewers felt it had a "cozy feel" with a bit of "old charm".

The Blue Moon Hotel, a renovated tenement building in the Lower East Side, features unique, meticulously restored rooms with original artwork and artifacts, offering a glimpse into historic New York. The hotel is described as a "hidden gem" due to its unique, boutique style, historic charm, and cozy atmosphere, setting it apart from generic hotels.

Broadway Plaza Hotel is a slightly hidden gem with a small street entrance that opens into a stunning interior and large, comfy rooms, and is located in a slightly obscure area. Some reviewers describe it as a "diamond in the rough" or a "slightly hidden gem".

The Buckingham is described as a well-kept secret, a hidden gem with apartment-style rooms, offering a unique and artsy experience steeped in music. It is located in an area where Carnegie Hall performers like to stay.

The Candlewood Suites Times Square is a new, clean hotel located a short walk from Times Square and Port Authority. It offers suite-style rooms with full kitchens and amenities like free laundry and Wi-Fi, but has a small lobby and limited services.

The Carlton Arms is an artsy, budget-friendly hotel where each room is uniquely decorated by different artists, offering a museum-like experience. It is known for its colorful, unconventional atmosphere and quirky charm.
The Carvi Hotel is a small, new, and renovated boutique hotel that opened in 2009, with some reviewers describing it as a "gem" and "treasure." It is somewhat non-descript, with a small lobby.

Casablanca Hotel is a small, quiet boutique hotel located just around the corner from Times Square that is described by many as a peaceful haven. It also has a Moroccan-themed decor, which many reviewers appreciated.

Chambers Hotel is a stylish, modern boutique hotel with a small, cosy lobby and industrial-style elevators, located just off 5th Avenue. The hotel is known for its dimly lit hallways with interesting art and unique room numbers on the floor.

Chelsea Lodge is a charming, affordable hotel on a quiet, tree-lined street in the Chelsea neighborhood, offering a cozy and clean stay with a unique, non-chain hotel feel. The hotel is located in a converted brownstone that feels like a home, with New England-style rooms and quirky decor.

Chelsea Pines Inn is a charming, movie-themed small hotel in Chelsea/Meatpacking district with uniquely decorated rooms, a garden, and a friendly cat, offering a cozy atmosphere with a personal touch. It is located close to subway lines, restaurants, and nightlife, making it a convenient and characterful alternative to large chain hotels.

The Chelsea Savoy is described as a "small boutique style hotel" and "best kept secret," offering a clean, simple, and affordable stay with a friendly staff. It's located in the Chelsea neighborhood, near the subway and various shops and restaurants, making it a convenient base for exploring the city.

City Club Hotel is a small boutique hotel with a discreet entrance and a cozy lobby, giving the feeling of a very private place. It is located on a privileged street near Times Square, but is not overwhelmed by pedestrian traffic.

Solita Soho is a small, modern boutique hotel located at the intersection of Chinatown, Little Italy, and Soho, offering clean rooms and a convenient location for exploring downtown Manhattan. Some reviewers mention a "gem" or "hidden treasure" quality due to its location and value.

Club Quarters Downtown is described as tucked away on a one-way street near the NYSE, providing a peaceful stay, while also being close to subway lines. The entrance might be unprepossessing due to the small area, giving it a sense of being a hidden find.

Club Quarters Midtown is described as a "little gem of a hotel" and "slick NYC boutique type hotel at a budget price" with a quiet elegance and unique check-in process, and rooms on upper floors have good views. The hotel has a "club" feel, with access to a living room with a bar, newspapers, and free internet; the restaurant is only for hotel guests and club members, and is rarely crowded.

Club Quarters Rockefeller Center is described as unassuming from the street, and relatively non-descript from the outside. Some reviewers mention that it feels private and discreet, like a hidden gem.

The Comfort Inn Chelsea is described by reviewers as a basic hotel in a great location that is a good value for the price, some consider it a hidden gem. The hotel is located on a quiet street near antique stores, close to the subway, the Flatiron Building and Madison Square Park, and some rooms have views of the Empire State Building.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan is described as an older hotel with a unique character and vintage charm, featuring stained glass windows in the reception/bar area and a quaint old-fashioned spiraling staircase. Some reviewers note that it was previously a 5-star hotel called the Gregorian, with remnants of elegance still visible.
The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is located in the heart of Chinatown, near the Manhattan Bridge, and offers affordable rates. Some reviewers felt the location was a "find" and a "hidden treasure".

The Comfort Inn Midtown, located half a block from Times Square, is described as a "gem of a hotel" and a "hidden jewel". Despite its central location, reviewers found the hotel to be surprisingly quiet and secluded.
The Comfort Inn on 44th St. is a new hotel located 1 1/2 blocks from Times Square with only 70 rooms, 10 per floor. Some rooms are located in the basement or open directly off the lobby.

The Comfort Inn is located on a slightly seedy looking side street but is a 5-minute walk to major attractions and offers free coffee and tea all day. The hotel is small and quiet, with rooms that are clean and nicely decorated, although some found it to feel more like a hostel.

The Comfort Inn Times Square is described as a "little gem," "hidden jewel," and "Times Square's Little Secret" due to its small size and newness, making it different from typical Midtown Manhattan hotels. Some reviewers note the hotel is narrow, tall, and has only a few rooms per floor, contributing to its unique feel.

The Cooper Square Hotel is a modern, design-focused boutique hotel that is described as small and mysterious with no visible signage outside. It offers a unique check-in process without a traditional front desk and is located in the Bowery/East Village area, which some cab drivers may not be familiar with.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is described as a clean, unpretentious, and modest hotel with great value, often referred to as a "gem" or "hidden treasure" due to its low price, location, and clean rooms. It is located in Tribeca near a subway, which gives it easy access to the rest of Manhattan.

The Courtyard Times Square South is a tall, narrow hotel sandwiched between office buildings, creating an oasis of calm and quiet just off of Times Square. Its location on a nondescript stretch of 40th Street, and its position between two larger buildings, make it feel tucked away.

The Courtyard Upper East Side is located in a quiet, residential area of Manhattan, away from the main tourist attractions, and close to the East River and Gracie Mansion. Some reviewers mentioned that the hotel felt like a great find or hidden gem, especially given the prices in the area.

The Courtyard Marriott Fifth Avenue is a smaller, narrower hotel, sometimes described as "squeezed" between buildings, with a tiny lobby, but some reviewers felt it had a boutique hotel feel. Some rooms have no views, facing brick walls, while others, particularly those ending in "01", are larger end rooms but also lack views.

The Courtyard Midtown East is described as unassuming, clean, and efficient, with large rooms for NYC standards, making it a "gem" due to its excellent value and friendly service. It's located in a safe, convenient area near the subway, offering a quieter experience away from the hustle of Times Square.

The Crosby Street Hotel is located in the heart of SoHo and features individually designed rooms, warehouse-style windows, oak-tree floors, and a bar with over 400 bottles. The hotel also offers a drawing room for afternoon tea.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square is centrally located but lacks a distinct atmosphere, being described as a "big hotel" without charm or personal touch. It is also undergoing renovations, which may make some areas of the hotel inaccessible.

The Da Vinci is a small, European-style hotel with a cozy lobby and free internet, located near Central Park and Times Square. Some rooms are small, but clean, with marble bathrooms, and the hotel has a restaurant and bar downstairs.

The Doubletree Guest Suites in Times Square is located in a busy area, but the rooms are serenely calm and offer exceptional value. Some reviewers consider it to be an unexpected gem or a home away from home.

The Doubletree Chelsea is described as being carved out of the side of a building, making it tiny and a bit of a surprise, located on a boring sidestreet in an odd area that is slowly being gentrified, giving it a hidden feel. The hotel is new and modern, clean, and comfortable.

The Doubletree Metropolitan has a retro, modern design with a lobby that has been redesigned and is clean and modern. Some reviewers found it to be a hidden gem, noting that it is a mix of updated and older features.

The Dream Hotel features a chic lobby with a two-story fish tank and offers a modern, trendy experience with blue neon lighting. Some found it more like a hidden treasure than other hotels in the area, although the rooms can be small.

The Duane Street Hotel is a small, upscale, and modern boutique hotel located in the Tribeca area, with a cozy vibe and uniquely designed rooms. Its smaller size allows for personal service, and it's conveniently located near multiple subway lines, providing easy access to various parts of the city.

The Dylan Hotel is described as a small, quiet, and modern boutique hotel with elegant design elements and touches of novelty such as laboratory beakers used as drinking glasses in the bathroom. Its unassuming entrance can make it easy to miss, contributing to a sense of discovery.

Eastgate Tower is described as a gem due to its great location, friendly staff, and spacious rooms, and is also known for being a good value. The hotel has an apartment-style layout and is located in the quiet Murray Hill neighborhood, within walking distance of Grand Central and other attractions.

The Econo Lodge Times Square is described as a "hidden gem" and "the best value for the location." Some reviewers say the hotel is clean, well-maintained, offers free amenities, and is staffed by helpful and friendly employees.

The Embassy Suites is located away from the hustle and bustle near the Hudson River, features river views, and is near Battery Park, a setting described as a best-kept secret and peaceful. Guests appreciate the space, waterfront location, and helpful staff, with return visits common.

The Empire Hotel has a trendy, recently renovated, boutique-style lobby with a "funky" bar, as well as a rooftop bar that provides great views. It is near Central Park and Lincoln Center, offering a location away from the chaos of midtown Manhattan.

Envoy Club offers spacious apartment-style accommodations with full kitchens, resembling a home away from home, and a rooftop deck with skyline views. It is located in the Murray Hill/Kip's Bay area, close to the Empire State Building and other attractions, but slightly removed from the main shopping areas.
The hotel is described as a "real cool hotel" and a "gem just off Wall St" with a stylish, boutique feel. Some rooms are very large for NYC standards, and rates are considered good.

The Excelsior Hotel is described as an elegant mid-class hotel with a quiet, residential location on the Upper West Side, near Central Park and the Museum of Natural History, offering a more local New York experience. The hotel has a classic, old-world charm with wood-paneled interiors, chandeliers, and clean, comfortable rooms, but may be a bit outdated and lacking in some amenities.

The Fairfield Inn is a new hotel centrally located near Times Square, offering a good value with clean and comfortable rooms. Though situated on a gritty street, it's conveniently close to the subway and various attractions, providing a hidden gem experience in the heart of NYC.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is described as a smaller, intimate "gem" or "oasis" amidst Midtown Manhattan, offering a quiet and peaceful respite with a European feel. Many found it a hidden gem of a hostelry and a perfect fit for those who crave warmth, comfort and peaceful luxury.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is described as a quaint, boutique-type hotel with a small, intimate atmosphere, and a cozy Irish bar, offering a warm, home-like feel with friendly, attentive staff. Some reviewers mention it feels like a "home away from home" and a "hidden treasure" due to its personalized service and comfortable accommodations.

Flatotel is described as a modern, stylish hotel with large rooms and a convenient midtown location, close to major attractions but tucked away on a quieter side street. Some reviewers mention it being a "hidden gem" or "undiscovered," while others note that its location provides a peaceful retreat away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

The Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Chelsea is described as a smaller, more intimate hotel, sometimes referred to as a "boutique" hotel, offering a cozy and quiet environment. Some reviewers noted the unassuming exterior and lobby belie the well-appointed and modern rooms, creating a sense of discovery.

The Four Points Soho is a new, boutique-style hotel that opened in late 2008, and is located on the edge of Soho near the West Village, close to subway lines and within walking distance of restaurants and shops. The hotel has a small lobby and a small bar that abuts the exterior.

The Four Points Times Square is described as a little gem that is well-located for business or pleasure if you can get a fair rate, and is also a good value and beyond expectations for such a central location in Manhattan. One reviewer mentioned feeling like they had discovered a "hidden gem" due to its introductory rate and newness.

The hotel's design is frequently described as beautiful, with a marble-look lobby and public areas that feel a world away from the bustle of New York streets. Some reviewers mention the hotel offers upper floor rooms, and the rooms have features such as dressing areas.

Gild Hall is described as a diamond in the rough, a hidden gem, and a secret that reviewers hesitate to share, with a tucked-away location close to the Fulton Street subway. The hotel's small lobby and newly renovated rooms offer a luxurious and quiet escape in the Financial District.

The Gramercy Park Hotel is a unique boutique hotel with a dark, artsy aesthetic, located in a quiet residential neighborhood with access to the private Gramercy Park. It features eclectic decor, original artwork, and a rooftop lounge, offering a different experience from typical hotels.
I'm sorry, but there doesn't appear to be any information about a hotel feeling like a hidden treasure.

The Greenwich Hotel is noted for its European-style decor, quiet atmosphere, and feeling of understated elegance, offering a unique alternative to classic Manhattan hotels. Its design features like wooden floors, cozy courtyards, and a Japanese-style pool contribute to a comfortable and inviting environment.

The Hampton Inn is a new hotel that some guests say does not feel like a typical Hampton Inn, with more modern furnishings and larger rooms than other Hampton Inns in NYC. Some guests felt it was a hidden treasure due to the good value, cleanliness, and location near the subway, Macy's, and the Empire State Building.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden is described as a "little gem" and "hidden in the big city," with a small street frontage that belies its 17 floors, offering modern, clean rooms and a friendly staff. Some reviewers noted that it felt like a "home away from home" due to the staff's attention to detail, despite the rooms being on the smaller side.

The Hampton Inn Chelsea is described as a "small gem" and a "little gem in the Big Apple", offering a blend of modern comfort and a convenient location in Manhattan. Several reviewers highlight its surprise value and consistent quality despite being a standard Hampton Inn, making it feel like a unique find.

The Hampton Inn SoHo is described as a "hidden gem" and "Soho jewel" offering incredible value and a modern, boutique-like atmosphere. It has a stream and buddha head in the greenhouse as well as a roof that retracts during the warmer months.

The Hampton Inn Times Square South is a narrow, tall building with only 6 rooms per floor, giving it a more private feel. Some reviews mention it being a "lovely little hotel" that feels tucked away despite its close proximity to Times Square and Broadway.

The Hampton Inn Seaport is described as a "small hotel" and a "little gem", tucked away on a side street, making it quiet despite its proximity to the Seaport. Some reviewers considered it a "best kept secret" and a "real find in NYC".

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older hotel with spacious rooms, some renovated, and a small lobby, situated in a central Midtown location near major attractions like Times Square and Grand Central Station. It offers a complimentary continental breakfast and has friendly staff, though some report dated decor and cleanliness issues.

The Hilton Club is a hotel-within-a-hotel located on the 37th and 38th floors of the Hilton, with a private check-in desk and dedicated elevators offering a small hotel feel. It features suites with well-designed spaces, Aveda amenities, and complimentary offerings like breakfast, wireless access, and a cocktail reception.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is described as a small, new, boutique-style hotel that's set back from the sidewalk, giving it a hidden gem feel. It's located in the flower district, offering a unique and fragrant experience.

The Hilton Garden Inn on 35th Street is described as a smaller, taller hotel that feels like a hidden gem due to its prime midtown location near the subway, Macy's, and various attractions, providing a sense of easy access without the overwhelming size of larger New York hotels. While unglamorous and functional, guests appreciated the cleanliness, newness, and quietness, making it a comfortable base for exploring the city.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square has a rooftop bar, the entrance is around the corner on 48th street, you have to show your room key and you are let in by the doormen. The rooftop bar has amazing views and is very classy.

The Hilton Garden Inn Tribeca is described as a "hidden gem" and a "basic stay place done right" in a "desolate" area of Tribeca, offering a functional and charming experience behind its doors. It is located in a quiet neighborhood with easy access to the subway and various parts of the city.

The Hilton New York is a large, busy hotel with a lobby that is compared to Grand Central Station, but it has reliable service, clean rooms, and is located close to many attractions. It may not offer a personalized experience due to its size and the high volume of guests.

Located on 41st and 42nd streets, this Hilton has modest entrances and a boutique feel, and rooms starting on the 23rd or 24th floor that provide quiet and escape from the bustle of Times Square. It is also described as being inconspicuous and smaller than other brand-name hotels, making the stay pleasant and relaxing.
The Holiday Inn Express is tucked away just off 5th Avenue and is described as a hidden gem. Its location is near major attractions, but the street is surprisingly quiet.

Located on W. 39th St. between 8th and 9th Aves, this new hotel is squeezed between a Candlewood Suites and Hampton Inn, a few blocks from the major hustle of Times Square. The hotel is tall and narrow with 30-something floors, with only about 5 or 6 rooms on each floor.

The Holiday Inn Express Chelsea is a newly opened hotel that many reviewers say was better than expected given its reasonable prices, clean rooms, and convenient location. The staff were friendly, a complimentary breakfast was offered, and free internet was available.

The Holiday Inn Downtown/Soho is described as a "good little gem" tucked away in a relatively quiet area near Chinatown, offering a clean and comfortable stay with a friendly staff. It's considered a "hidden jewel" by one reviewer, with everything within walking distance.

The Holiday Inn Midtown, though basic and needing renovation, offers spacious and clean rooms, a rooftop pool, and a central location near Central Park, making it a practical choice for tourists; some reviewers found the hotel to have a distinct smell and mixed experiences with the staff.

The Holiday Inn on 26th St is described as a tall, slender hotel surprisingly located on a quiet street between Chelsea and the Flatiron District, with a small lobby that can feel like a "tall secret." Some rooms offer great city views, and the hotel is far enough from Times Square crowds but close enough to see the lights.

Hotel 17 is a budget-friendly hotel with a European style, quirky decor, and a lot of character, situated in a quiet, safe, residential neighborhood near Union Square. It has an old-fashioned charm, a funky lift, and rooms decorated in a sometimes quirky way, giving it a unique and cozy feel.
Hotel 31 is a budget-friendly option with a retro feel, old-fashioned elevators, high ceilings, and wood mouldings. It is located in a traditional New York style building.

Hotel 373 is described as a small, "boutique" hotel that is clean, modern, and trendy, with a cozy atmosphere, often compared to European hotels. It is centrally located near the Empire State Building and other attractions, offering a good value for its location.

Hotel 41 is a small, clean boutique hotel conveniently located near Times Square with friendly staff, and while rooms are small, it offers amenities like free breakfast and DVD rentals. Many reviewers use terms such as "gem" and "find" when referring to this hotel.

Hotel 99, located on the Upper West Side, was still under construction during the period of the reviews, offering discounted rates. Some reviewers found it to be a "nice discovery" and "best deal in New York City" due to its modern, clean rooms and convenient location near the subway.

Hotel Beacon is described as a "gem" or "hidden gem" by reviewers, with a boutique flavor, a welcoming gem on the Upper West Side, a welcoming gem on the Upper West Side, and close to many great attractions. The location in REAL NYC is a plus.

The Hotel Chandler is a smaller, quiet boutique hotel located on a side street near the Empire State Building, with clean, well-decorated rooms and a friendly staff. Some reviewers describe it as a hidden gem due to its central location, reasonable price, and smaller size compared to larger chain hotels.

Hotel Deauville is a budget-friendly, older-style hotel with an antique, manually operated elevator, and some rooms have purple bathrooms. It is located in midtown Manhattan, close to the subway and within walking distance of attractions like the Empire State Building.

The East Houston Hotel is described as discreet and a "nice little NYC oasis" with an Asian minimalist decor, cherry wood floors, and Bulgari toiletries. It has a rooftop terrace with views of the Empire State Building and is located in a vibrant and trendy part of town, away from the touristy areas.

Hotel Elysee is a small, elegant boutique hotel with a European ambiance, offering a quiet oasis in midtown Manhattan and a homey feel; it is conveniently located near attractions like Central Park and 5th Avenue. The hotel features a library-style common room serving complimentary breakfast and afternoon wine, creating a cozy and intimate atmosphere.

Hotel Gansevoort is a modern and stylish hotel located in the Meatpacking District, known for its trendy vibe, good restaurants, and rooftop bar that is a popular spot in NYC. It offers luxurious rooms, although some are small, and some reviewers mention noise issues.
Hotel Giraffe is described as a "hidden gem" and a "special hotel in NYC" that is also a "small gem devoted to providing excellent service." It is a boutique hotel with a relaxed atmosphere.

The Grand Union Hotel is a budget-friendly option in midtown Manhattan, noted for its clean rooms and proximity to attractions like the Empire State Building, though some rooms may be small, dark, or noisy. Some reviewers describe it as a 'wee gem' of a hotel, a 'rare diamond in Manhattan,' or a place that feels like a 'find.'

Hotel Indigo has a modern, minimalist design with clean, refurbished rooms, but some reviewers feel it lacks unique character and is missing amenities. The hotel is in a good location, close to restaurants, subways, and galleries.
Hotel Mela is described as a chic boutique hotel that is a hidden treasure. It is located on a quiet side street right off Times Square.

Hotel Metro is a small, well-located hotel on a relatively quiet street, offering a welcome oasis from the bustling midtown area, with past guests describing the hotel as a hidden gem. The hotel also has a rooftop bar/terrace with great views of the Empire State Building.

Hotel Newton is a clean and budget-friendly option located on the Upper West Side, near the subway, described as a little-known gem. It is known for its convenient location, cleanliness, and proximity to the subway.

The Hotel on Rivington, located in the Lower East Side, is described as a little glittering gem rising from the gloomy tenement buildings surrounding it. It has a low-key entry and quiet, confident vibe and offers comfortable bedrooms with killer views from the upper floors.

Hotel Reserve is described as a "hidden gem" and a "great little hotel" that is small, clean, modern, and quiet, located in the Financial District. It is situated on a side street near several subway stations, close to Wall Street and Ground Zero, and across the street from the Federal Reserve Bank.

The St. James Hotel is a budget-friendly option with a superb location near Times Square, and some reviewers describe it as a "gem" or "hidden jewel" due to its reasonable rates. It is an older, basic hotel, but many reviewers found the rooms clean and adequate for sleeping, with delis and Irish pubs nearby.

Hotel Stanford is a budget-friendly option in the heart of Koreatown, close to major attractions like the Empire State Building and Macy's, with some rooms offering city views and a glimpse of the Empire State Building. Some guests have described it as an older, basic hotel with small rooms, while others have found it clean and well-located, with some renovated bathrooms.

Hotel Wales is a "quaint" hotel with "old world charm" located on the Upper East Side near Central Park and Museum Mile. It has a rooftop terrace with city views, and some rooms feature original woodwork and nonworking fireplaces.

The Hudson Hotel's entrance is unmarked, giving it a hidden feel; the lobby and reception are accessed via a fluorescent green escalator, creating a sense of entering another world. The hotel lobby and corridors feature dark and moody decor, with exposed brick, ivy, and low lighting, adding to the feeling of discovering a trendy, unmarked location.

Ink48 is a new, modern, and stylish hotel located on the west side of Manhattan, a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square, in the up-and-coming Hell's Kitchen neighborhood. The hotel features spacious rooms with city or Hudson River views, though some construction and unfinished amenities were noted during its soft opening phase.

Inn New York City is a small, four-unit inn located in a converted brownstone on a quiet street in the Upper West Side, with no identifying sign outside. The inn is designed to feel like a private residence, with each suite uniquely decorated with antiques and personal touches.

The Intercontinental Barclay, with its old-fashioned ambience, has a grand lobby and a location that is just far enough from the major attractions to offer a quieter, more relaxed atmosphere. Some reviewers mention feeling like they've discovered a hidden treasure by finding it on Priceline or Hotwire at a bargain rate.
The Jumeirah Essex House is an art deco hotel with a prime location on Central Park South. The hotel has been renovated and has features such as touch screen telephones and automatic lighting.

The Kitano is a smaller, Japanese-themed hotel located in the quiet Murray Hill area, near Grand Central Station, with clean rooms and soundproof windows for a peaceful stay. Guests have noted the hotel's serene atmosphere and described it as an oasis of calm, with touches like green tea makers and jazz in the bar.

La Quinta Inn Manhattan is described by reviewers as an older, no-frills budget hotel with a rooftop bar offering a great view of the Empire State Building, and while the rooms can be small, cleanliness is generally high. Easy to miss since there is no banner sign, but only smallish plaques on the facade.

Lafayette House is a 15-room boutique hotel in a townhouse setting with individually furnished rooms featuring antiques and fireplaces. It is located in the East Village, with access to a courtyard and nearby restaurants.
Le Parker Meridien has a "secret" burger joint in the lobby hidden behind a curtain and a hidden airline boarding pass kiosk. One reviewer stated that the place was a "well-situated gem."

The Library Hotel is a unique boutique hotel with a library theme, offering a calm and elegant atmosphere, 
The staff is friendly and the rooms are small and cozy.

The Loews Regency is described as having a more convivial feel due to its relatively small size compared to larger luxury hotels, with a pleasant and cozy lobby preserving historical touches. Some reviewers mention that the hotel feels old-school and tired, with some rooms needing refurbishment.

The Lowell is a small, intimate hotel on the Upper East Side, off Madison Avenue, in a residential area a couple blocks from Central Park. It is described as a quiet and elegant European-style hotel with a small, dark lobby, but large and exquisite rooms, some of which have kitchenettes and terraces.

The Mandarin Oriental New York, located on the 35th floor and up of a tower in Columbus Circle, offers amazing views and is attached to the Time Warner Building. It also has a private passageway to the Shops at Columbus Circle mall in the Time Warner Center.

I'm sorry, I am unable to extract details to fulfill that request. The reviews focus on the Milford Plaza's central location, small rooms, and ongoing renovations; with most describing it as adequate and budget-friendly, but not a hidden treasure.

The Millenium Hilton offers modern, clean rooms with breathtaking views, and is in a quiet location next to Ground Zero, with the subway nearby. Some reviewers found it charming due to its distance from touristy areas and great views.

The Millennium Broadway is conveniently located in the heart of Times Square and features clean, spacious rooms and art deco decor. The hotel has a quiet lobby and the rooms provide a respite from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.

The Millennium UN Plaza hotel, though sometimes outdated, provides large, quiet rooms with exceptional views of NYC, and multiple reviewers found the location a good distance from the bustle of Times Square. Because of the high-floor location, views of the East River and the city skyline are generally outstanding.

The Moderne is a small, older, 37-room hotel located off Broadway, with modern decor, sometimes quirky layouts, and small rooms. Some reviewers describe it as a "gem" due to its hidden location, finding it a good value for the location despite its lack of amenities.

Morgans Hotel is a boutique hotel that is hard to find because the name is not visibly displayed outside, giving it a hidden feel; the design-focused hotel has a modern, minimalist style with checkerboard patterns. The hotel has a living room area for guests and is known for its friendly, helpful staff.

Murray Hill East Suites is described as a hidden gem and a good value, with spacious rooms and a location in a safe, quiet neighborhood. Many reviewers mention that it feels like an apartment, with a kitchenette and a homey atmosphere.

The Murray Hill Inn is described as a "small treasure" and a "hidden find in Murray Hill" offering a European flavor and simple, clean rooms in a safe area. It's noted for its great location, cleanliness, and reasonable rates, making it a good value for budget-aware travelers.

The Marriott Downtown is located in a quiet area of lower Manhattan near the Hudson River, close to Ground Zero, with subway access; rooms on higher floors offer excellent views, and it is known for its comfortable beds. Some reviewers mention that the price is good for the area.

The New York Marriott East Side is in a historic building with a charming lobby, but the rooms are small and the elevators are slow. Some guests have described the hotel as old-fashioned, while others have appreciated its quiet and homey atmosphere.
I am sorry, I cannot answer this request. The hotel in the reviews is a large and busy hotel in Times Square, which is the opposite of a hidden treasure.

The New York Palace, formerly the Helmsley Palace, includes a modern hotel tower built in 1980 above the historic 19th century brownstone Villard mansions behind St. Patrick's Cathedral, and has a beautiful courtyard featured in the TV show "Gossip Girl". Some rooms offer pleasant views of St. Patrick's Cathedral or other city landmarks.

The Night Hotel is a small boutique hotel with a black and white gothic theme, often described as sexy, trendy, and stylish. It is located just steps away from Times Square, giving it a hidden treasure feel despite its central location.

The hotel is described as being well-hidden and accessed via an elevator to the 7th-floor lobby, giving it a sense of separation from the street crowds. Some found the hotel provided great value and an excellent location.

Off Soho Suites is described as an apartment-style hotel offering clean and spacious rooms with kitchenettes, situated in a location that is close to multiple neighborhoods and subway lines. Some reviewers mention the hotel's location in a commercial district gives it an "industrial" feel, while others praise the hotel for being a good value and close to many attractions.

The Omni Berkshire Place is described as having a boutique feel despite being a fairly large hotel, with a quiet atmosphere, elegant old-world decor, and well-maintained rooms giving the sense of a hidden gem. Some reviewers mention it feels like a more intimate hotel, and that guests felt like they were coming home to a haven.

On The Ave is described as a gem and a nice find, with urban boutique feel, sleek minimalist decor, and a location that feels like a real neighborhood, away from tourists. Some reviewers describe it as a nice surprise, a comfortable gem, and an excellent choice.

Park 79 is described as a cozy, hidden gem on a quiet, tree-lined street in the Upper West Side with a historic feel due to its old-world charm and pre-war moldings. While basic, it offers clean rooms and a convenient location near Central Park, museums, and subway lines.
The hotel's lobby has a sophisticated look, and some reviewers mention getting a room on a higher floor, possibly with city views. Rooms facing inside are quiet but have no view.

The Park South Hotel is described as a "little gem" and "hidden treasure" with a boutique-type atmosphere, offering a clean, comfortable, and quiet stay at a reasonable price for New York City. The hotel has a European feel, with a continental breakfast, and is located near a subway for easy access to other parts of the city.
The Peninsula has an intimate lobby, and multiple seating areas that make it feel more like a private club than a hotel. The design of the hotel is such that it feels more intimate than other hotels.

The Phillips Club offers studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments with kitchens for daily, weekly, or monthly rentals, appealing to those seeking a temporary home with a mix of hotel and condo living. It is located near Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle, with convenient access to subway lines.

The Plaza Athenee is an intimate, European-style boutique hotel on a quiet, tree-lined street on the Upper East Side, near Central Park and Madison Avenue. It has a residential feel and is described as a quiet oasis, offering a relaxing retreat with attentive staff.

The hotel is old with small rooms, but some rooms have a view of the Empire State Building and it is near a subway station and Macy's. There is a little gift shop and limited free internet, but no room safes.

The Ramada Eastside is described as a hidden gem in Murray Hill, with recently remodeled rooms and a good location near restaurants and the subway. Some reviewers were hesitant to share this find, wanting to keep it a secret for themselves.

The Red Roof Inn is a budget-friendly hotel located in Korea Town with a central location near the Empire State Building, clean rooms, and views of the Empire State Building from some rooms. Reviews mention the hotel being a great find and that it is located in a bustling, safe street with many restaurants.

Renaissance 57 is described as a quiet gem and a chic boutique hotel, with a sleek and modern decor and a European feel. Some reviewers mention that it feels unique, intimate, and personal, unlike a standard Marriott property.

The Renaissance Times Square is described as an intimate and understated "hidden gem" amidst the mayhem of Times Square, offering a quiet oasis of luxury. It is also described as an excellent, modern hotel with cool decor and a modern/futuristic, yet classy, theme.

The Residence Inn Times Square offers a quieter, more independent hotel experience, away from the crowds, with spacious, clean rooms and a substantial, Middle America style breakfast. Many reviewers recommend corner rooms on the upper floors for spectacular city views, with some offering views of the Empire State Building.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park offers a quiet, peaceful, and less crowded experience, located at the southern tip of Manhattan away from the hustle and bustle of midtown. It is close to Battery Park attractions and offers waterfront views, with luxurious rooms and great service.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel is described as a "hidden gem" and a "lovely surprise", with a discreet entrance giving it a boutique-hotel feel. Some found the hotel to be small and intimate with clean, modern rooms.

The Roger Smith Hotel is a small boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan with unique, uniquely decorated rooms, friendly staff, and a homey atmosphere. Some reviewers describe it as a hidden gem with a convenient location and excellent service.

The Roger Williams Hotel is described as a trendy, modern boutique hotel with a great location in Murray Hill, offering a hidden gem-like experience with friendly staff and comfortable rooms, and with superstars lounging around. Reviews highlight its unique decor, stylish lobby, and exceptional service, further contributing to its appeal as a distinctive and memorable stay.

Room Mate Grace is described as a hidden gem and a boutique hotel with a cool vibe and stylish bar, located just steps away from Times Square. Its decor is quirky and fun, with a 24-hour pool and a lobby bar that attracts both hotel guests and locals.

The Royalton is located in a narrow, unmarked building, making it easy to walk past. The dark lobby, hallways, and elevators contribute to a mysterious and unusual atmosphere, reminiscent of a night club rather than a typical hotel.

The Salisbury Hotel is described as a "little gem" with a "New York kind of way" authentic and beautiful feel. The location is great, and there's a good comfort and good staff, also near main streets and the metro.

The San Carlos is described as a smaller, intimate boutique hotel, and a hidden gem, with quiet, well-maintained rooms, luxurious bedding and bathrobes, Aveda bath products, free Wi-Fi, and friendly staff. Some reviewers mention that it provides a serene escape from the bustling city, with large rooms, in a central location, but without the hustle of Times Square.

Seafarers International House is a budget-friendly accommodation option located near Union Square, offering basic, clean rooms with options for shared or private bathrooms. It is known for its unbeatable location and value, making it a hidden gem for travelers seeking affordable stays in Manhattan.

This hotel is a large and busy convention hotel with a newly remodeled lobby and a large fitness center; it is located close to major attractions. Some reviewers describe the rooms as small, dated, and not particularly luxurious, but well-located.

The Skyline Hotel is described as a hidden gem with large, clean rooms and comfortable beds, located within walking distance of Times Square. It might not look attractive from the outside, but it is ideally located in a reasonably quiet surrounding.

The Smyth Tribeca is described as a new, modern boutique hotel in a relatively quiet area of lower Manhattan, with a subdued, modern lobby featuring cozy nooks. Some reviewers mention that the Smyth feels like a hidden treasure and is a perfect urban refuge, due to its anonymous and quiet nature.
The Sofitel New York is located on a quiet street, offering a relaxing respite from the city. The hotel is described as having a "boutique" feel, and is praised for being clean, quiet, and luxurious.

The Soho Grand features a hip and trendy atmosphere, a lobby decorated with industrial-chic decor, and vintage touches, with unique, elegant design, a dark, moody interior, dimly lit with vintage touches, and artwork, giving a classic "Gotham City" type of feel. The hotel offers a "Seduction in Soho" package and gold fish for company and quiet rooms.

Soho House New York is described as a cool and trendy hotel with fabulous decor, vintage furniture, and spacious rooms that are individual; as a private club, hotel guests have access to Soho House events, a pool table, a table football table, board games in the bar, and free wi-fi. The hotel is located in the Meatpacking District, which is described as an atmospheric area with shops, restaurants, and cobbled streets.
The Stay Hotel has a trendy lobby and bar area that some guests found to be a unique surprise, contrasting with the exterior of the building. The hotel is located a half block from Times Square.

The Alex Hotel is described as a "hidden gem" and a "well-kept secret" in midtown Manhattan, offering a taste of true New York with nice apartments equipped with kitchenettes. It's located in a bustling city center, yet it offers a wonderful, quiet escape with a contemporary flair.

The Belvedere is located on a quiet street off 8th Avenue, near the Theater District and Times Square, which some reviewers describe as a "gem" or "hidden secret." The hotel offers a boutique experience with a friendly atmosphere, and provides easy walking access to midtown destinations.

The Benjamin is a small, quiet boutique hotel that some reviewers describe as a hidden gem due to its Beaux Arts-style dcor and attentive staff. Some reviewers felt the service was top-notch and made them feel at home.

The Blakely is described as a smaller, boutique hotel that some reviewers almost hate to "discover" and keep a secret. It's also considered a "hidden treasure" with an "old world feel" and a personal service.

The Bowery Hotel is described as a gem with a vintage, old-world charm, offering a unique and authentic New York experience away from typical tourist spots. Its decor blends traditional elements with modern flair, and it has a cozy, intimate atmosphere.

The Bryant Park Hotel is described as a gem with a great location in Midtown Manhattan, offering a hip and trendy atmosphere, that can feel like a peaceful haven. Some reviewers also noted its location next to Bryant Park and close to the New York Public Library, with modern rooms.

The Carlton on Madison is a smaller, renovated hotel with stylish, clean rooms, a stunning lobby, a mezzanine Champagne bar, and a central Manhattan location near the Empire State Building and other attractions. Reviews suggest its location is a bit removed from busier areas, offering a quieter atmosphere, but the hotel may have small rooms with crown moldings, dark hallways, and occasional noise issues.

The Carlyle is a classic, old New York hotel that feels intimate, with a lobby reminiscent of "old money" elegance. It has white-gloved elevator operators and a staff that provides personalized service.

The Franklin Hotel is a small, European-style boutique hotel on the Upper East Side with an old-fashioned elevator, a complimentary breakfast, and an evening wine and cheese reception. It is located on a quiet street near the subway, Central Park, and museums.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments is described as a hidden gem, a charming European-esque boutique hotel that's clean, beautifully decorated in a French Orleans style, and offers personalized service. It is located on Restaurant Row, close to Times Square, and offers quiet rooms with comfortable beds.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea is described as a "hidden gem" and a "charming little neighborhood GEM" that's tucked away on a residential street, steps away from 8th Avenue. Its location in the heart of Chelsea is just far enough from Times Square to avoid the crowds and noise, with a subway stop just a block away.
The GEM Hotel is described as a "boutique hotel" that is bare bones and minimal, yet stylish and modern. The hotel is considered an affordable but chic option.

The GEM Hotel is described as a "gem of a place" and a "hidden gem" that is small but well-maintained with newer furnishings. The hotel is located on the edge of the Lower East Side, close to many attractions and subway lines.

The Grant Hotel, also known as the Devon or Alexandar, is located in a safe neighborhood on the Upper West Side, close to the subway and Riverside Park; the hotel itself is in an older building and does not have a sign outside. Some rooms have been renovated and include a TV and AC, but bathrooms are shared and some rooms face brick walls.

The Hampton Inn Times Square North is described as a hidden gem that offers great value, excellent service, and clean, spacious rooms, making it a perfect base for exploring the city while saving money compared to other New York hotels.

The Helmsley Carlton House is located on the upper east side of Manhattan, one block from Central Park, in a quiet location. Some rooms are spacious suites with kitchenettes and sitting areas, and some have balconies overlooking Central Park.

This hotel, located on Central Park South, has a dated or "vintage" atmosphere with some old-style decor, as well as some more "gaudy" or "kitsch" furnishings. Some reviewers found it charming in an old-fashioned way, while others found the decor tired, dirty, and in need of renovation.

The Herald Square Hotel is a budget-friendly option with a central Manhattan location, praised for its cleanliness and comfortable beds, with some rooms newly renovated; it is described as a "gem" due to its location, value, and unique Life Magazine decor. Keep in mind that some rooms are small and may have limited views.

Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Chinatown and described as a "gem" and a "hidden treasure" by reviewers. The hotel is new, very clean, and modern with spacious rooms and comfortable beds, but has minimal decor.

The Hotel at Times Square is described by many guests as a hidden gem, due to its location that is close to many attractions and general cleanliness. It is centrally located, recently renovated, and offered at a reasonable price.

The Inn at Irving Place is described as a hidden treasure with no signage, tucked away on a street with admired architecture. Its decor is authentic 19th century, lovely, and gracious, contributing to the feeling of stepping into another world.

The Iroquois is a small, elegant boutique hotel with a cozy, intimate atmosphere, often described as a hidden gem or home away from home, located on a quiet street in midtown Manhattan, close to major attractions but away from the hustle and bustle.

The Jane Hotel has a vintage vibe with small, cabin-like rooms reminiscent of a sleeper train in the 1930s, and is located in a historic building that once housed Titanic survivors. It is undergoing renovations and combines hotel rooms with long-term residential rooms, creating an interesting mix of people.

The Kimberly Hotel is described as a "best kept secret" and "hidden treasure" that is cozy, comfortable, and a great value with suite-style rooms. The rooms are noted to be spacious and well-appointed, more like an apartment than a typical hotel room.

The Lombardy is a small, quiet boutique hotel on 56th St between Park and Lex, with individually owned rooms decorated in different themes and equipped with kitchens. The hotel's location provides convenient access to restaurants, shops, and the subway.

The London NYC is described as a modern, chic, and spotless hotel, often praised for its spacious rooms and central Midtown location, offering a quiet escape with well-equipped suites and a friendly staff; though some found it impersonal or noticed noise issues. Some reviewers found the design stylish and well-thought-out, while others considered it bland or focused on trendy aesthetics over comfort.

The Lucerne is described as a hidden gem offering a pleasant surprise with its restored and tastefully decorated classic style. It is located on the Upper West Side, in a quiet area near Central Park, with easy access to restaurants and shops.

The Manhattan Club is described as a "well-kept secret gem" and "hidden treasure", with many reviewers noting its excellent midtown location. It has spacious suites, a 26th-floor lounge, and helpful staff.

The Mansfield is a small boutique hotel with a classic, European feel, a library with a fireplace, and a bar area, centrally located near Times Square. It has small, stylish rooms with Aveda toiletries and offers complimentary coffee and breakfast.

The Marcel at Gramercy is described as a modern and funky boutique hotel with clean rooms, a rooftop terrace, and a pleasant staff, located in a less touristy area of Manhattan with a neighborhood feel. Some reviewers mention the rooms are small, but stylishly decorated, and some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.
The Maritime Hotel has a nautical theme with porthole windows, dark hallways, and ship cabin-like rooms. It is located in the Chelsea/Meatpacking District.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. Some reviewers mention that the hotel needed renovations in the past, but it has since been updated with modern designs.

The Marmara Manhattan is located on the Upper East Side in a residential area, offering spacious apartment-style rooms with full kitchens and amenities, making it feel like a home away from home. It is situated a few blocks from the subway, providing easy access to other parts of the city while maintaining a quieter neighborhood feel.

The MAve is described as a new, clean, and stylish hotel with a vibrant lobby and a staff known for exceptional service, located in a central but not overly touristy area of Manhattan. Some reviewers mention it feels like an upscale hostel due to the lack of facilities and small rooms, but appreciate its unique charm and personalized service.

The Mercer is a chic, understated boutique hotel in SoHo with a relaxed vibe and a lobby that feels like a comfortable living room, open only to hotel guests. Its entrance is unobtrusive and easy to miss, offering a tranquil escape from the bustling city.

The Michelangelo Hotel is a smaller, luxury boutique hotel with a grand palace feel, offering elegant, comfortable rooms, great service, and a location convenient to many NYC attractions. The hotel's atmosphere is often described as a calm oasis, with a beautiful lobby featuring classical music and European-style decor.

The Milburn Hotel on the Upper West Side is described as a hidden gem, offering a quieter, more residential experience away from the tourist crowds, and a good value for the location. It has spacious, apartment-like rooms with kitchenettes and is close to Central Park and subway lines.

The Muse Hotel is a smaller, boutique-style hotel located on a quiet street just off Times Square, offering a more intimate and peaceful escape from the busy city center. Its decor is described as trendy, modern, and creative, with a design that feels a little like home.

The New York Helmsley has a dimly lit lobby and was described as having a bit of a 1980s time-warp feel to it with furniture from that era and green and gold decor. It is described by one reviewer as having a NYC flavor and feeling like a small boutique hotel.

The New Yorker Hotel, built in 1929 with art deco styling, has been recently renovated to highlight its historical design. The hotel has a mix of updated and small rooms, some offering Empire State Building views.

The Pierre is an iconic hotel with old-world charm, elevator operators, a functional mail chute, an expansive marble lobby, and crown moldings. It is located across from Central Park and has been recently renovated.

The Plaza has a sense of history and presence that makes it very New York, with traditional-style rooms that have tried to recapture some of the original Plaza hotel. Some public rooms are still being renovated, but the newly discovered and uncovered stained/leaded glass ceiling in the Palm Court is spectacular.

The Pod Hotel is praised as a hidden jewel and a gem of a place, with a clean, modern, and funky style that exceeds expectations. It is also described as a great find with a cosy and welcoming atmosphere, a rooftop terrace, and an excellent location.

The Premier is a boutique hotel within the Millenium Broadway that some guests were upgraded to, and is described as a "hidden gem" and "oasis" due to its quietness despite being steps from Times Square. Some reviewers mention the hotel having concierge service, complimentary breakfast and evening reception, and modern, serene rooms.

The Ritz-Carlton Central Park is described as having an inconspicuous entrance, providing a quiet and serene experience despite its location on 6th Avenue, and offering a personal feel due to its relatively small lobby. Some reviewers mention interior rooms lack a view, offering more privacy.
The Roosevelt Hotel has a beautiful lobby that feels like stepping back into the 1930s, with elegant, grand, and old-world New York charm. It's considered a "grand dame" with a classic style.

The Sherry-Netherland is a small, intimate hotel with only 50 rooms and suites, many of which are individually owned and furnished, offering a unique and private experience. It is located on Fifth Avenue, across from Central Park, and provides a quiet respite from the city.

The Shoreham is a smaller, modern, and trendy boutique hotel with a chic lobby, located on a quiet street in midtown Manhattan. It offers comfortable rooms, a 24-hour cappuccino/espresso bar, and a stylish bar/restaurant.

The St. Regis is described as a classic, old-world hotel with a hushed elegance, offering a relaxing escape from the busy city. Its smaller size and elegant decor are said to discourage tourist crowds, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

The Standard Hotel is constructed on massive concrete stilts and straddles the High Line, giving it a unique architectural presence; the elevators have video screens playing a mesmerizing presentation with music. The hotel has a trendy, underground feel, with rooms featuring floor-to-ceiling windows offering impressive views, and the building's design incorporates modern and chic elements like yellow entrances and revolving doors.

The Surrey is a smallish boutique hotel on the Upper East Side of New York City, buried in the midst of townhouses, with a quiet location near Central Park. It feels like an actual New York City Hotel, not a classic or intending to be luxurious, with an easy-going, zero-pretense environment.

Located in a historical Harlem neighborhood, the Sylvan Guest House offers apartments in a townhouse with unique design and African art decor. It is near the Jumel Mansion and a short subway ride to Manhattan.

The Time is described as a "diamond in the rough" and a "hidden gem", being nestled in the busy Broadway area and not very apparent from the outside. It is also characterized as a small, sophisticated boutique hotel with modern, funky interiors.

The Waldorf Astoria is a historic hotel with art deco architecture, a grand lobby, and displays of old photos and memorabilia. Some reviewers mention that the hotel feels like a step back in time and has the charm and elegance of a bygone era.

The Westin New York at Times Square is located a block from the heart of Times Square, providing a serene escape from the city's bustle, with many rooms offering Hudson River views and modern decor. Despite its large size and central location, guests describe the hotel as quiet and peaceful, with well-maintained, clean rooms.

The Thirty Thirty Hotel has a distinct, but not always positive, atmosphere, with some reviewers describing a "surreal movie set" or "upscale youth hostel" feel; however, if you seek a "treasure" outside of your hotel, it is centrally located near the Empire State Building and subway lines. Rooms range in quality, from small, dingy rooms to renovated executive rooms and can be a "find" if booked at the right price.

The Thompson LES is a modern, stylish hotel in the Lower East Side with spacious rooms, floor-to-ceiling windows offering great views, and a location near many restaurants and shops; however, some amenities may not be available. Reviewers note a "hip" vibe and proximity to interesting and authentic places, but also mention ongoing construction and potential noise issues.

Travel Inn is described as a "gem," "hidden treasure," and "best-kept secret" due to its surprising cleanliness, spacious rooms, and free parking, all at a reasonable price for its location near Times Square. The deli next door, a grocery store a block away, and pool access add to the feeling of discovering a great value.

The Tribeca Grand is a trendy hotel with a stylish lobby, dimly lit interiors, and an atrium design, offering a unique atmosphere away from the congestion of Midtown. It is located in a convenient area in walking distance to Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy.

The Trump International Hotel is described by reviewers as a potential "best kept secret," with an understated lobby creating a cozy environment where staff provide personalized service and make guests feel like royalty. The hotel offers spacious suites, luxurious amenities, and great views of Central Park.

The Tudor Hotel is described as a charming, old-world hotel with a historic building listed in the National Register of Historic Hotels and Tudor City, with quiet parks and river views. Some reviewers found it to be a hidden gem with a quiet location, but others found it plain and outdated.

The Avalon, now Vincci Avalon, is a smaller, older boutique-style hotel that is centrally located and described as a hidden gem. Guests consistently mention the large room sizes for NYC standards and the friendly staff.

W The Court is described as a smaller, boutique-like hotel, with a residential feel and a somewhat secluded location. The lobby is noted for its dark, cozy atmosphere, which some reviewers found appealing.

W Tuscany is described as a gem hidden away in central Manhattan, a sophisticated and cosy smaller hotel. The hotel has a quaint lobby, luxurious rooms with video screens and access to the Wet Bar in the neighboring W Court Hotel.

The W Times Square is a trendy, modern hotel with a cascading waterfall entrance, a hip lobby bar, and recently updated rooms, offering a peaceful, luxurious hideaway in the center of Times Square. It aims to be a quality five-star escape from the hustle and bustle, with quiet rooms and attentive concierge service, despite being close to the action.

The W Union Square, occupying a historic insurance building, has a trendy atmosphere, a lobby bar, and a basement lounge ("Underbar"), with some reviewers noting the hotel's unique architectural features. The hotel offers rooms that are seen as havens by some and a bit grungy by others.

The Waldorf Towers, located within the Waldorf Astoria, offers a more private experience with a separate entrance and dedicated staff. Guests describe the hotel as having an old-world charm and a sense of history, with spacious suites and classically decorated rooms.

The Wall Street Inn is a small, quiet boutique hotel located on a quaint street in the heart of the financial district, described as a hidden gem. It is tucked away between non-descript buildings, offering a peaceful stay away from the hustle and bustle of mid-town.

The Warwick is a historic hotel with an old-world charm, a small, intimate lobby, leather couches in the bar, and a comfortable, vintage feel. Some reviewers describe it as a more European Botique style hotel.

The Washington Jefferson is described as a "hidden gem" and "deliciously located" occupying a large building well integrated into the surrounding neighborhood. It is considered a great find due to its location and unassuming nature.

The Washington Square Hotel is described as a charming, quaint, and boutique hotel with an art deco style, located in the heart of Greenwich Village. The hotel's lobby and some rooms are decorated with an art nouveau/art deco style reminiscent of old movies.

The Wellington Hotel has a romantic, old-fashioned vibe with art deco details, and it is located next to Carnegie Hall with a vintage feel in Midtown. Many reviewers said it was near many attractions, but it is located on a busy street.

The hotel is described as a new, modern property that feels like a studio apartment, with a small lobby that resembles an apartment entry area. It's located in midtown Manhattan, next to Carnegie Hall, offering a convenient location close to Central Park and the Theater District.

The Wingate Inn is described as a "gem" and "hidden treasure" due to its smaller size, attentive service, excellent staff, and great location near major attractions like Penn Station, Macy's, and Times Square. It's located in the garment district on 35th street and offers a clean, modern, and comfortable stay with complimentary breakfast and internet.

The Wolcott Hotel, built in 1904, features a Beaux-Arts lobby and pre-war New York ambiance, with spacious rooms, and is located two blocks from the Empire State Building. The historic hotel has a gym, laundry facilities, lockers, a business center, and offers muffins and coffee in the morning.

Woogo Central Park offers apartment-style accommodations with kitchenettes, providing a taste of New York living away from touristy areas, situated in the Upper West Side near Central Park and subway lines. It is in an older building and offers few amenities or services.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel - Times Square South is described as a "hidden gem" and a "diamond of a hotel" by multiple reviewers, with many citing its newness, cleanliness, and modern decor as delightful surprises. While the neighborhood is described as "gritty" and "sketchy," many appreciate that the hotel itself feels like an oasis and a welcome respite from the busy city.
